Row.Text: Punic Wars

Mercenary Units benefit from the Great General combat bonus and their Contracts last 50% longer. Units may cross mountains after the first Shophet is earned, taking 50 HP damage if they end a turn on a mountain.
Our people are now climbing mountains on elephant-back and purchasing your Tyrian Dyes! I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
Consult the Hundred and Four

Even the most battle-hardened of commanders may be blind to the strategies employed by our enemies. We should have our greatest general seek the advice of our Tribunal of Judges before facing battle.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Carthage (Hannibal) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must have a Shophet stationed in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per era [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Shophet gains +2 [ICON_MOVES] Moves and +1 Sight, and ignores enemy Zone of Control

Even the most battle-hardened of commanders may be blind to the strategies employed by our enemies. We should have our greatest general seek the advice of our Tribunal of Judges before facing battle.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Shophet gains +2 [ICON_MOVES] Moves and +1 Sight, and ignores enemy Zone of Control
Consulted the Hundred and Four
+2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement and +1 Sight, and ignores enemy Zone of Control.
Restore the Power of the Suffetes

Slowly, this government has crept into desuetude. Carthage's politicians are complacent and fat, and her Judges meek and uninspired. It would take little for the government to collapse and fall pray to some foreign despot. That is why we must revitalise the power of the Suffetes, and guarantee the security of our democratic Magistrate Lords.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Carthage (Hannibal) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have researched {1_TechDesc} [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{3_Reward}
Courthouses are [ICON_PRODUCTION] built in half the usual time
Courthouses, Magistrates Courts, and High Courts are [ICON_PRODUCTION] built 50% faster
{1_LeaderName} of {2_CivName} has re-organised his government and restored the power of the democratic Magistrate Lords.
The merchants of {1_City} have begun a new practice called 'auctioning,' in which goods are paraded to the highest bidder within a crowd.
Xanthippus the Mercenary General
An informant of ours has given to us the name of a foreign mercenary general: Xanthippus. Should we agree to pay the general's hefty fee, our troops would surely benefit from his tutelage.[NEWLINE]
We shall not pay Xanthippus' absurd price.
Very well. Pay the man what we wishes, so long as he guarantees us victory.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]A 'We Love the King Day' begins in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Receive a free {2_UnitDesc}.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All current Land Units earn +15% more XP from combat[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT][ENDCOLOR]
We have turned away an offer to hire Xanthippus the mercenary general.
We have hired Xanthippus the mercenary general to lead our troops.
At the behest of {1_LeaderName}, Xanthippius the mercenary general has been recruited to train the {2_CivAdj} army.
Xanthippus' Tutelage
Earns +15% more XP from combat.
Mago's Writings

Day in and day out, the rather dull recluse Mago has been tending to his rather drab record of our people's agricultural practices. It is said that any who would read such material would surely perish, for such boredom the mind cannot withstand. Now, however, the bland man has asked that his government fund the final chapters of this most insipid manual, so that he might see it finished.[NEWLINE]
Throw him out! This government cannot fund such blather.
Very well, so long as I do not have to read it.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Every city gains {2_Num} [ICON_FOOD] Food[ENDCOLOR]
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain {1_Num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in the [ICON_CAPTIAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR]
We have declined to fund Mago's writings.
We have agreed to fund Mago's writings.
Imilce
